html:
Alternative forms[edit]

  • inpediō

Etymology[edit]

From in- (“into, in”) +‎ pēs, pedis (“feet”) +‎ -ō; literally, to "shackle the feet".

Pronunciation[edit]

  • (Classical) IPA(key): /imˈpe.di.oː/, [ɪmˈpɛ.d̪i.oː]
  • (Ecclesiastical) IPA(key): /imˈpe.di.o/, [imˈpɛː.d̪i.ɔ]

Verb[edit]

impediō (present infinitive impedīre, perfect active impedīvī or impediī, supine impedītum); fourth conjugation

  1. I hinder, impede, obstruct, hamper, thwart
  2. I embarrass

Descendants[edit]

  • Italian: impedire
  • Sicilian: mpidiri
  • ⇒ Vulgar Latin: *impedīscō, *impedīscere
    • Old Portuguese: enpeeçer
      • Galician: empecer
      • Portuguese: empecer
    • Spanish: empecer
  • → Catalan: impedir
  • → English: impede
  • → Galician: impedir
  • → Piedmontese: impedì
  • → Portuguese: impedir
  • → Spanish: impedir

See also[edit]

  • impedicō
